turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Scouting Nederland.
turn.1: What kind of vessels are used in Dutch Sea Scout groups?
turn.2: The total fleet of all Dutch Sea Scout groups consists of 54 guard ships, 120 tugboats and motorboats, 100 "Lelieschouwen", 1,550 "Lelievletten" (iron sailboat for 6 persons) and 40 "Juniorvletten" (smaller size of the Lelievlet).
turn.3: What age do the Scouts range from?
turn.4: Sea Scouting has its own sections for many age groups, but Cub Scout and Beaver Scout Sections can also be a part of the Group.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Officially, there are specialized Sea Scout programs for 12 years and older.
turn.8: Until 2010 there was a special water programme for age 8 to 11, Dolfijnen (Dolphins).
turn.9: What did that program consist of?
turn.10: This is being replaced by a redesigned "Welpen" programme with a second main character, the girl Shanti, and more water animals.
turn.11: What is the most common age?
turn.12: Members are called "Water Scouts" from 12 to 16 years or more often "Zeeverkenners", a unit is referred to as "Wacht" ("Watch").
